text: Haiti competed at the 2019 Pan American Games in Lima, Peru from July 26 to August 11, 2019. Haiti is one of only 17 countries to have participated in all editions of the Pan American Games. In July 2019, the Haitian team of eight athletes (four per gender) competing in six sports was officially named. This was later reduced to seven when rower Gabrielle Amato withdrew after sustaining an injry. During the opening ceremony of the games, taekwondo athlete Aniya Louissaint carried the flag of the country as part of the parade of nations. ==Competitors== The following is the list of number of competitors (per gender) participating at the games per sport/discipline. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! width=138|Sport ! width=55|Men ! width=55|Women ! width=55|Total |- | align=left|Athletics (track and field) | 2 ||1||3 |- | align=left|Judo | 1 ||0||1 |- | align=left|Swimming | 1 ||1 ||2 |- | align=left|Taekwondo | 0 ||1 ||1 |- ! !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result |-align=center |align=left|Aniya Louissaint |align=left|+67 kg | L 3–18 |colspan=5|Did not advance |} ==Non-competing sports== ===Rowing=== Haiti received a reallocated quota in the women's single sculls event. Gabrielle Amato had to later withdraw after sustaining a back injury before the games. ==See also== *Haiti at the 2020 Summer Olympics ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 Pan American Games 2019 Category:2019 in Haitian sport
